snippet: Pedro Espada Jr., a former New York State senator who was found guilty of theft, accused the trial judge of improperly pressuring jurors to reach a verdict.
abstract: Pedro Espada Jr, former New York state senator convicted in 2012 of stealing hundreds of thousands of dollars from nonprofit Soundview Health Center in the Bronx, accuses federal trial judge in his case of improperly pressuring jury to reach its verdict, and files motion seeking new trial; motion comes just days before his scheduled sentencing.
lead_paragraph: Pedro Espada Jr., a former New York State senator who was found guilty of theft, accused the trial judge of improperly pressuring jurors to reach a verdict.

headline.seo: Sentencing Near, Espada Seeks a New Trial
